title: CS-LIT
description: CS-LIT, aka "Computer Science Like I'm Ten," is a web community platform featured on Product Hunt, where users explain complex CS subjects using everyday analogies.

This fully functional product enables users to sign up, contribute, and explore analogies for challenging CS topics. As the sole developer, I built CS-LIT from the ground up, embracing the project as both a learning experience and a personal challenge.
The platform serves as a collaborative space where individuals can share their unique perspectives, making computer science more accessible and enjoyable for learners of all levels.
features: User Registration, Login, and role-based access.
Login Options: Social login providers, email magic link.
Dedicated Auth pages for login and registration.
Fully typesafe architecture (back to front) using tRPC for API.
Redux state manager chosen for handling growing complexities in states.
Unit tests via Vitest and End-to-end (e2e) tests using Cypress.
Docker implementation for flexible deployment.
Handled Error boundaries with dedicated error pages.
Descriptive error messages for better user experience.
Zod used for robust data validation.
Responsive design for optimal user experience.
Clean code and organized folder structure.
Share analogies via link or convert DOM into an image using html2canvas.
Commenting system for user interaction.
Voting and user validation system for analogies.
Using code snippets with syntax highlighting support.
Markdown support for enhanced content formatting.
Search system with debounce for finding topics.
Infinite scroll using React Query for every list of data.
Utilized React Query for stale-while-revalidate fetching and implemented skeleton loadings for better UX.
Full admin panel for publishing, editing, or deleting entities.
challenges: Managed coding, design, and marketing solo, requiring effective time management and prioritization.
Leveraged comprehensive tools to overcome resource limitations, especially in database management and hosting, for efficiency and cost savings.
Prioritized user experience with refined interaction, optimized loading, intuitive UI, and tailored personas, complemented by skeletons and loading indicators.
Improved performance with efficient caching and optimization techniques for a responsive user experience.
Implemented targeted testing for reliability and robustness, emphasizing quality assurance efforts.
Established CI/CD pipelines for seamless project delivery and development optimization.
Embraced the opportunity to learn and implement Redux state management as project development progressed, recognizing the increasing complexity of states.
Pursued self-directed learning to expand frontend skills and explore backend and devops technologies proactively.
Successfully launched on Product Hunt, leveraging community feedback for project enhancement.
Incorporated user feedback through voting and comments to enhance satisfaction and interaction.

Undertaking the entire development cycle independently, from conceptualization and system design to implementation and launch, necessitating self-reliance and adaptability to address various technical and logistical challenges solo.

title: this.covered
description: Introducing "this.covered" — a playful and client-side website crafted to empower individuals in enhancing their LinkedIn profiles with eye-catching header images.

With the tagline "Wanna get discovered? You got this.covered!", the platform aims to elevate personal branding by offering a simple and enjoyable image creation experience. Utilizing the Unsplash API, users can easily find and customize header images that resonate with their professional identity. Elevate your online presence with "this.covered" and make a lasting impression.
I hope you find all the easter eggs I put in this project :)
descriptionShort: This is a short description of the second project.
features: Client-Side Project via Vite.
Used Unsplash public and private API to find images.
Add a small box of personal information to your cover photo.
Save your custom cover photo to your device.
Offering a checklist of tips and tricks to create a more complete LinkedIn profile.
Typesafe via TypeScript.
Responsive Design and Mobile-Friendly: Implemented swiping for mobile.
Implemented Dark Theme utilizing CSS variables and media queries, enhanced with browser's local storage integration.
Deployed on Github Pages.
challenges: Integrated Unsplash API seamlessly, incorporating both the free private API and public API to mitigate request limits during high loads, ensuring continuous usability while maintaining zero costs. This enabled users to effortlessly find and customize header images, contributing to increased user engagement and satisfaction.
Implemented Dark Theme feature to enhance user preferences and accessibility, while maintaining visual coherence.
Received positive user feedback on the simplicity and effectiveness of the platform, validating design and usability decisions.

title: this website!
description: I wanted my portfolio website to be more than just a showcase—it became a journey of exploration and learning.
In this project, I decided to dip my toes into Sass for a cleaner style and ventured into 3D web design using Spline, inspired by my past experiences with 3D software in school.

It serves as a testament to continuous learning and experimentation, striking a balance between visual elegance and performance across diverse devices and hardware. With a keen focus on audience demographics and purpose-driven design, the portfolio embodies a space for discovery while showcasing my work effectively.
descriptionShort: Short description for the third project.
features: Incorporated React's suspense feature and utilized UI fallback for loading states.
Utilized Spline, which uses Three.js, for 3D and interactive objects on the web.
Minimal usage of 3d objects, keeping Performance Measures for Low-Tier Devices in mind.
Abillity to filter Projects via Skill Tags.
Opportunity to Learn Sass for a more clean and modern styling solution.
Responsive Design across all devices and screen sizes.
Typesafe via TypeScript.
Implemented Project Routes via Next.js App Router.
challenges: Incorporated 3D design with Spline, striking a balance between simplicity and creativity in the portfolio's visual appeal. Maintained optimal performance through code-splitting and device detection, ensuring each user's experience is fine-tuned based on monitor size and GPU tier.
Learned valuable lessons in rendering patterns and streaming server-side rendering for improved performance.
Implemented Sass for styling, improving maintainability and code organization, while adhering to industry best practices.
Maintained a sharp focus on audience demographics and employed UX persona practices to enhance user experience, aligning with the portfolio's core objectives.

title: Futpal
description: Futpal is a web application tailored for Fantasy Premier League (FPL) enthusiasts, designed to provide a toolkit for FPL managers seeking to elevate their game.

With live Premier League game results sourced from a third-party API, users can stay on top of the action in real time. The application goes beyond the surface, offering granular in-game fantasy statistics and numbers retrieved from the unofficial FPL API, by overcoming the classic CORS problem.
Futpal aims to empower FPL managers with the insights and tools they need to make strategic decisions and stay ahead in the fantasy football realm.
descriptionShort: Short description for the fourth project.
features: Live Premier League game results from a third-party API for real-time updates.
Granular in-game fantasy statistics and numbers retrieved from the unofficial FPL API.
In-App Currency system for user transactions.
Empowers FPL managers with insights and tools for strategic decision-making.
Opportunity to learn about PWA (Progressive Web App).
Utilized react useContext hook for state management.
Responsive Design.
Typesafe via TypeScript.
challenges: Implemented a CORS proxy solution to overcome restrictions and access real-time in-game stats and data from the official Premier League server, ensuring seamless functionality and user experience. Utilized a custom server configuration to listen on specific hosts and ports, allowing unrestricted access.
Successfully integrated third-party APIs for real-time non-fantasy game results, ensuring comprehensive data access and functionality.

Crafted an in-app currency system, balancing inputs, outputs, and prices to ensure natural flow and usability. This enhancement elevated user engagement, interaction, and presented monetization avenues.
Effectively utilized react useContext for state management, including its usage in detecting users' devices to render the appropriate UI for enhanced user experience.
Tailored platform specifically for Fantasy Premier League (FPL) enthusiasts, meeting niche market needs and demonstrating market awareness.
Seized the opportunity to delve into Progressive Web App (PWA) development, aligning with Futpal's need for an always-accessible application, thus expanding skillset and expertise.

title: Adeptivity
description: Adeptivity marks the online presence of an international startup, offering a landing page and a dynamic blog section. The landing page, crafted with Next.js, serves as a captivating introduction to the startup's offerings and ethos.
For the blog, I implemented a combination of Next.js and Strapi, leveraging the ease of Strapi as a content management system.

This setup not only ensures a seamless and responsive landing page experience but also provides the startup with a user-friendly platform to share insights and updates through an efficiently managed blog.
descriptionShort: Short description for the fifth project.
features: Online presence for an international startup.

Implemented a dynamic blog section with Next.js and Strapi, leveraging Strapi as a user-friendly content management system for seamless and responsive content management, ensuring efficient sharing of insights and updates.
Used Theme-UI for a unified design and make responsive design easy to implement for all developers.
challenges: Created an online platform optimized for an international user base, showcasing attention to design and frontend elements tailored to cater to a global audience.

Employed Strapi as the content management system for the dynamic blog section, integrating it seamlessly with Next.js. The choice of Strapi was deliberate, as it provided a user-friendly interface that writers and editors found comfortable to use. This integration ensured efficient content management, facilitating seamless sharing of insights and updates.
Received positive feedback on the design and usability of the landing page and blog section, validating design decisions and user experience.

Gained invaluable insights into project coordination and collaboration through interactions with diverse startup stakeholders. This experience involved effective communication with individuals from varying backgrounds and positions, necessitating the use of a language tailored to convey messages clearly and effectively. These engagements further honed communication and teamwork skills.
Managed to launch the website within a tight deadline, with the aim of delivering a user-friendly and efficient platform.
Handled SEO optimization and implemented best practices for increased online visibility and reach, ensuring successful online presence and brand awareness.
Continuously updated and maintained the website with relevant content and features, keeping it relevant and engaging for users and stakeholders.

title: Notopia
description: Notopia is my take on a note-taking app (since every developer has one), both for the web and desktop.
It features a block-style text editor (a simple Notion clone, if you will), relying on EditorJS library.
On the desktop, I used Electron, keeping things simple and using as few third-party libraries as possible.
descriptionShort: Short description for the sixth project.
features: Note-taking app for web and desktop.
Block-style text editor reminiscent of a Notion clone.
Used local storage + custom hooks for data persistence.
Desktop version built with Electron, focusing on simplicity.
Minimal reliance on third-party libraries, with only EditorJS for editing.
Customized EditorJS's design to seamlessly fit into the project.
Straightforward and practical tool for efficient note-taking.
challenges: Implemented masonry layout without using third-party libraries, implementing only JavaScript and CSS.

Prioritized user experience considerations by implementing necessary features while maintaining a simple and non-threatening design approach. Utilized a familiar style reminiscent of Notion block-style editors, while customizing the design to align with the project's unique identity.
